channel.title: VirtualBox - Whonix Forum
channel.description: Topics in the 'VirtualBox' category Everything specific to Whonix VirtualBox. (devs)

item.title: Cloning old gateway, but password is different?
item.dc:creator: Alex78H
item.description:
I’d full cloned whonix gateway & workstation in virtualbox (with new MAC address) for onionshare. After creating 2 new internal networks for the clones however, when adding sudo onion-grater-add 40_onionshare into gateway’s terminal, it said input password, but oddly enough, it is neither my changed password from the original gateway, and “changeme”. Plus, when inputting the password in the terminal, it show ***** instead of not appear in screen, which it shouldn’t.

How do I see my current clone sudo password? And if that wasn’t the main issue, then what is?

9 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Cloning old gateway, but password is different?

item.title: VirtualBox 7.0.0 not compatible with Whonix on macOS hosts
item.dc:creator: gonein5
item.description:
From the changelog:

macOS host: Dropped all kernel extensions. VirtualBox relies fully on the hypervisor and vmnet frameworks provided by Apple now. At the moment the implementation lacks “Internal Networking” functionality. This will be provided at a later date.

Unable to test but “Internal Networking” is what Whonix uses to communicate between VMs. Until the functionality is implemented, the 6.1 branch is still available and will be supported until December 2023.

(I wanted to provide links but the system won’t let me.)

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: VirtualBox 7.0.0 not compatible with Whonix on macOS hosts

item.title: A lot of package hash mismatches when trying to update new system
item.dc:creator: zenix
item.description:
Whonix installed from Whonix-XFCE-16.0.5.3.ova

First run of Whonix Gateway

First system update

sudo apt dist-upgrade (after sudo apt update, which succeeds, see other topic about random segfaults) produces a lot of hash mismatch errors like:

E: Failed to fetch tor+https://deb.kicksecure.com/pool/non-free/v/virtualbox-guest-additions-iso/virtualbox-guest-additions-iso_6.1.38-1_all.deb Hash Sum mismatch
Hashes of expected file:
- SHA256:3b3f229c8de3ccaef47c0adb2319e8df2928869a29bcd1beb396405cf5ef9f54
- SHA1:cd998b89f5c078877c0f72315b6d7e59faf0ef5f [weak]
- MD5Sum:8260df881bc328754777b0f51f3d64dd [weak]
- Filesize:47381132 [weak]
Hashes of received file:
- SHA256:94ae8bc1bb7e27c04bd14f9ff61b1895ff2b0776f0aa6ad33ca3d74693c0de1d
- SHA1:ef87c79ea64214cc3b771578f2a5068b717be456 [weak]
- MD5Sum:8260df881bc328754777b0f51f3d64dd [weak]
- Filesize:47381132 [weak]
Last modification reported: Sun, 11 Sep 2022 22:19:55 +0000
E: Unable to fetch some archives, maybe run apt-get update or try with --fix-missing?

4 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: A lot of package hash mismatches when trying to update new system

item.title: Ledger not detected in VirtualBox on Linux
item.dc:creator: metalworker
item.description:
Hello,

I am trying to use Ledger + VirtualBox + Whonix and when I try to connect the Ledger to Whonix in VirtualBox settings, I get “No device available” message.

Version details:

  • Ledger Nano X, firmware and apps up to date
  • Host machine: Linux Mint 20.3, firmware and software up to date
  • Whonix version: 16.0.4.2, software up to date

Steps to reproduce:

  • Apply the udev rules needed for Ledger on Linux on both the host machine and the Whonix VM.
  • Shut down Whonix VM, restart host machine
  • Connect Ledger, enter Ledger PIN, open Monero app. Open Ledger Live and perform “genuine check” to make sure Ledger is detected, get confirmation that Ledger is genuine and connection is confirmed.
  • Open VirtualBox on host machine. Click “Settings” on Whonix VM in VirtualBox, go to USB, check “Enable USB Controller”, click “Add filter”
  • See error message “No device available”. Cannot proceed from here.

Any ideas about what the issue could be?

4 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Ledger not detected in VirtualBox on Linux

item.title: CLI vs GUI difference
item.dc:creator: Komms
item.description:
Can someone explain the difference between the CLI vs GUI.

In past times on a windows host I have used VB so I am familiar.

Now on linux host I am already running the kvm Virt Manager with windows guest isntalled. So I was going to run Whonix on kvm. I followed the instructions and ran into an issue with the qcow2 files filling up my root partition which is set at 30GB causing computer operating issues. My home partition is total 1T. My understanding is the qcow2 files must be on the root partition. I guess I can just increase the size of my root partition to make this work?

If I instead install the VB;

  • If I install the CLI will that use less ram than the GUI?
  • If I install the CLI will that CLI be just for both the Gateway and the Workstation, or is the CLI just for the Gateway and the Workstation still installs the GUI?
  • If they are both CLI format what user interface will On the CLI it the only interface I see be the actual Tor browser? I already have a Tor browser on the same machine so would that CLI install interfere with the already existing Tor? How would I run things like cryptop wallets I would need to use the just the command line version of those apps?

From the description here
Dev/VirtualBox - Whonix?

The section - “Why use VirtualBox over KVM?” - it sounds like the VB does a better job at isolating Whonix from the host? Can someone elaborate on this from a privacy perspective and tell me which install provides the least attack surface or compromise, KVM or VB?

Thanks.

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: CLI vs GUI difference

item.title: Tor browser crashing and whonix glitching
item.dc:creator: x99x
item.description:
Hoping someone could help.

I have installed Virtualbox as per the instructions here:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox/Recommended_Version

  • I am running the latest kicksecure as my host on bare metal
    Also Running Latest Debian kernel and linux-headers as instructed.

  • vtx and vtd are both enabled as well in bios settings.
    workstation and gateway both have 2gb of ram
    Also have given both 128mb of vram

  • I am Having alot of issues in terms of whonix glitching and displaying random colors here and there and also core dumps.

The main issue is:

  • Tor Browser is consistently crashing as well giving the error:
ERROR: Tor Browser ended with non-zero (error) exit code!

Tor Browser was started with:

/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/start-tor-browser --verbose --allow-remote . 

Tor Browser exited with code: 139

I tried to update tor browser but still having the same issue with it.
I had this issue running on regular non kicksecure debian 11 host as well.

Downgrading the host kernel fixed the issue on my other machine
But i don’t want to downgrade my kernel on this kicksecure machine.
Other vitrual machines are not suffering the same issue despite the kernel version.

Thanks.

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Tor browser crashing and whonix glitching

item.title: Core Isolation in Windows 10 breaks Whonix
item.dc:creator: Jondoesnowden
item.description:
Core Isolation in Windows 10 breaks Whonix in several ways.

Does anybody know if this is a Whonix problem or a VirtualBox problem?

When having Core isolation activated I get problems with:

Booting, I get an error stating “bug” somthing “CPU” something “29s”

Freeze during boot.

It takes 3-6 boots just for entering Whonix

Sometimes after boot the mouse will not move with the need to reboot.

Updating TOR-Browser in the browser is crashing after the Browser does an exit to start installation, leading to TOR-browser will fail to start so you need to install it with command line.

Some crashes now and then with an unresponsive Whonix but a responsive VirtualBox

This means that you will not be able to use Whonix in Windows 11, because Core Isolation is mandatory in Windows 11.

8 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Core Isolation in Windows 10 breaks Whonix

item.title: [solved] swap-file-creator breaks with Whonix 16 for VirtualBox and newer Linux host kernel version 5.18
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:

And by this error whonix wont load (only black screen).

Note: vbox (virtualbox-dkms,virtualbox-qt,virtualbox) installed from sid repository (but there is no version differences between sid and upstream)

Workaround: keep ON/OFF the vm until it will load instead of the black screen.

item.source: [solved] swap-file-creator breaks with Whonix 16 for VirtualBox and newer Linux host kernel version 5.18

item.title: Tor Browser crashing in Whonix VirtualBox since upgrade to Host Linux Kernel version 5.10.0-15
item.dc:creator: midge
item.description:
I have an issue with Tor Browser crashing in Whonix in debian virtualbox.
The issue seems to be whonix related as I did the following after it started crashing:

  1. I upgraded debian to the latest. (only TZDATA needed upgrading, my system is alaways within a day of latest update)
  2. It still crashed
  3. I upgraded to the latest virtualbox and extensions pack (from 6.1.30 to 6.1.34)
  4. still crashed
  5. I downloaded latest tor browser on my workstation. Worked with no issue.
  6. I downloaded the same tor-browser within whonix-workstation and ran that version.
  7. It crashed as the default installed one!

Running from the terminal, in debug mode, I got the following:

user@host:~$ torbrowser
Fontconfig warning: “/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/TorBrowser/Data/fontconfig/fonts.conf”, line 85: unknown element “blank”
Fontconfig warning: “/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/TorBrowser/Data/fontconfig/fonts.conf”, line 85: unknown element “blank”
Fontconfig warning: “/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/TorBrowser/Data/fontconfig/fonts.conf”, line 85: unknown element “blank”
Fontconfig warning: “/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/TorBrowser/Data/fontconfig/fonts.conf”, line 85: unknown element “blank”
Fontconfig warning: “/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/TorBrowser/Data/fontconfig/fonts.conf”, line 85: unknown element “blank”
Exiting due to channel error.
Exiting due to channel error.
Exiting due to channel error.
Exiting due to channel error.
/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/start-tor-browser: line 362: 7071 Segmentation fault (core dumped) TOR_CONTROL_PASSWD=${TOR_CONTROL_PASSWD} ./firefox --class “Tor Browser” -profile TorBrowser/Data/Browser/profile.default “${@}” < /dev/null
[ERROR] [torbrowser] Tor Browser ended with non-zero (error) exit code!
Tor Browser was started with:
/home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/start-tor-browser --verbose --allow-remote .
Tor Browser exited with code: 139

Can I give any other info to help?

Thanks

51 posts - 13 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser crashing in Whonix VirtualBox since upgrade to Host Linux Kernel version 5.10.0-15

item.title: (Still Unsolved)While taking off. The power went off. Now Whonix is always off

Result Code: NS_ERROR_FAILURE (0x80004005)
Component: MachineWrap
Interface: IMachine {85632c68-b5bb-4316-a900-5eb28d3413df}

Nothing can be done except refresh

Is it possible to get anything from them? I have some bookmarks in the browser

Thanks In Advance

item.title: sdwdate on old version workstation
item.dc:creator: lattt
item.description:
hi, at first sorry for my english and propaply stupid question. I’m using old version workstation - 4.19.0.9, and from today (it worked yerstaday) it can’t make sdwdate succes. Initial time fetching in progress all time. I suspect that it’s because sdwdate is trying request urls from old onion sites (with short adress), for example (I deleted urls because this site tell me that I can’t post urls):

2022-05-22 10:16:46 - sdwdate - INFO - Running sdwdate fetch loop. iteration: 3
2022-05-22 10:16:46 - sdwdate - INFO - Requested urls [‘gmg7jl25ony5g7ws’, ‘bvhfrslkkdbncdhv’]
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - Returned urls “[‘gmg7jl25ony5g7ws’, ‘bvhfrslkkdbncdhv’]”
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - remote 0: gmg7jl25ony5g7ws
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * comment: Gizmodo Media Group specialprojects
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * status: False
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * value: Timeout
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - remote 1: bvhfrslkkdbncdhv
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * comment: Canal Etico denuncias.bufetecarrasco
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * status: False
2022-05-22 10:17:36 - sdwdate - INFO - * value: Timeout

and so on many many times. By the way, internet works ok without sdwdate succes.

My new workstation request this urls from new onion sites(with long adress) and everything ok. I don’t sure that problem is what I just said, but anyway I want to make sdwdate succes on my old workstation, is it possible? Or now I can only use new version? Propably I can somehow upgrade that onion site’s list, or something like this. I tried to google it and read curl manual (if I comprehend right sdwdate uses curl), but it’s all too hard for me.

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: sdwdate on old version workstation

item.title: I have ram issues
item.dc:creator: ElCoquilletos
item.description:
Hi,
I have ram issues: I have allocated 11G of ram to my whonix workstation, but it use only 1 giga.
My host OS is windows and when I chack the task manager, it is writed that the whonix workstation use 11 giga of ram, but when I do the free --giga command in the workstation, it always use only one giga (10 giga are free).
So my workstation freeze when I just open tor or open a new tab and sometimes it completly freeze.
Best regards
ElCoquilletos

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: I have ram issues
